message: Can anyone offer any examples of how this variation might play out in a scene? Preferably hypothetical examples as well as examples from real movies.

In the Dramatica software program, being as concern has a story example from Rebel Without a Cause.  "The teen characters are concerned with what it means to be a teenager.  One way this is illustrated is in their "uniform" attitude..."  It continues with tons of examples throughout the movie.

@travelingleonards this would be the perfect kind of question for http://dramaticquery.com. Something like "What are some examples of State of Being as an Issue?". If there's anyway you could ask it over there, then people could respond with their possible answers I think it would be helpful for others in the future.

OK, couldn't wait! Went ahead and made my own question for it - http://dramaticaquery.com/questions/31/what-are-some-examples-of-state-of-being-as-an-issue -- thinking of doing this on a weekly basis, give people an opportunity to do some public StoryEncoding. Do one if you want, everyone can vote -- the one with the most votes by the end of the week wins!
